meanings.definition: To temporarily stop something from continuing or operating.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to suspend the game due to the storm.
meanings.sent2: They will suspend the construction work until the safety inspection is complete.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to suspend the audience's disbelief with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent4: The news of the victory seemed to suspend time itself for a moment.
meanings.sent5: The emergency brake can suspend the train's movement in an instant.

meanings.sent1: She decided to suspend the bird feeder from the tree branch.
meanings.sent2: The chandelier was designed to suspend gracefully from the ceiling.
meanings.sent3: The spider tried to suspend its web between two tall plants.
meanings.sent4: The clouds seemed to suspend the sun in the sky at sunset.
meanings.sent5: The artist used fishing line to suspend the sculpture in the gallery.

meanings.sent1: They had to suspend the meeting until the CEO arrived.
meanings.sent2: The airline decided to suspend all flights due to the storm.
meanings.sent3: The procrastinator would always find ways to suspend doing his homework.
meanings.sent4: The decision to move to a new city seemed to suspend their plans for a while.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected snowstorm would suspend the start of the outdoor concert.
